Kadanwari Gas Field (}}), located in the Middle Indus Basin of Pakistan, was discovered in 1989 and is currently operated by OMV Pakistan.
OMV Pakistan took over the operator-ship of the Kadanwari Gas Processing Plant on 1 January 2003 from Lasmo, currently ENI. Kadanwari plant gas processing capacity has been enhanced to  per day at standard conditions [http://www.ppepca.com/communitydevelopment/OMV.html]
Sui Southern Gas Company buys  per day of gas from this gas field, while it has the capacity of supplying  per day of gas. [https://web.archive.org/web/20100115202229/http://www.geo.tv/4-21-2009/40347.htm]
It has an air link to Karachi via Kadanwari Airport, with flights operated on charter basis.
See also
* Energy law
* Sawan Gas Field
